intro: Cristaria parvula, commonly known as the small-crown snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Bradybaenidae and is native to parts of North America. The shell of Cristaria parvula is typically small, with a conical shape and a smooth surface. It is often found in moist, forested environments where it feeds on decaying plant matter. This species plays a role in nutrient cycling within its ecosystem.
